intro: Lasiacis sorghoidea var. patentiflora, commonly known as the patentiflora sorghum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy inflorescences. The plant produces clusters of small, fluffy flowers that are often white or pale pink in color. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it suitable for cultivation in arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ornamental and ecological studies.
